review: If you have a Roku you are better off than with the chromecast. The only reason I got it is the ability to cast a chrome browser window from the laptop without getting the HDMI canle out.  This works reasonable well, however I noticed some bluriness and also some unaligned audio/video but wouldn't be certain that the chromecast was to blame.

review: If you want to project photos from your phone, this works fine.  If you want to show netflix to a tv, fine (although every dvd player out there does the same thing) If you want to show local video, (video you have ripped from your DVD) on your TV, forget it.  I paid for the movie once when I bought the dvd but now Google thinks I should buy the movie again through Google movie and tv app to show it via Chromecast.
